title: Liverpool could be without Joel Matip for next SIX matches as row with Cameroon FA continues
text:
Sport Liverpool could be without Joel Matip for next SIX matches as row with Cameroon FA continues The defender was left out of Sunday's draw with Manchester United as uncertainty over his eligibility continues and Liverpool have been infuriated by FIFA’s failure to provide any clarity Share Liverpool could be without Matip for another six weeks (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Joel Matip could miss Liverpool's next six matches. 
The defender was left out of Sunday's draw with Manchester United as uncertainty over his eligibility continues. 
Liverpool looked to secure clearance from FIFA after Matip turned down the chance to play in the Africa Cup of Nations with Cameroon. 
The Cameroon Football Federation is adamant Matip shouldn't be allowed to play for Liverpool for the duration of the tournament, reports the Liverpool Echo. 
However, the 25-year-old defender, who hasn’t played for Cameroon since September 2015, considers himself retired from international football and had always made it clear that he wasn’t available for selection. Matip in action during training (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) The defender has impressed this term (Photo: 2016 Getty Images) 
Liverpool have been infuriated by FIFA’s failure to provide any clarity on the issue. The world governing body have merely stated that if the Reds were to play Matip without Cameroon’s permission then it could lead to disciplinary action being taken. 
A FIFA spokesman said: “We can confirm that Liverpool FC contacted FIFA about the matter and our services answered by directing the club to the applicable provisions. 
“A player who has been called up by his association for one of its representative teams is, unless otherwise agreed by the relevant association, not entitled to play for the club with which he is registered during the period for which he has been released or should have been released pursuant to the provisions of this annexe, plus an additional period of five days.” Matip claims he has retired from international duty (Photo: Matthew Lewis) Read More Liverpool to snub Newcastle interest in winger 
FIFA also stated that “any potential violation of the applicable provisions would need to be investigated by the FIFA disciplinary committee”. 
Asked if they would step in to resolve the row and when a decision was likely, the spokesman told the Liverpool Echo that “no further comment on the issue could be provided”. 
If Cameroon were to reach the final of the Africa Cup of Nations on February 5 then Matip wouldn’t be available to play for Liverpool until February 10. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
